metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35654 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Pillow before 8.1.0, TiffDecode has a heap-based buffer overflow whendecoding crafted YCbCr files because of certain interpretation conflictswith LibTIFF in RGBA mode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.3
python-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.3
python3-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.3
python3-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-1ubuntu0.3').
